  • Method Details

    • getInboundFileConfig

      InboundFileConfig getInboundFileConfig()

    • isFileValid

      @Deprecated default boolean isFileValid(String filename)
      Deprecated.
      implement use isFileValid(gw.api.inboundfile.InboundInputFile)
      Check to see if a file is valid. If a file is not valid, it will be marked as error, and the OnLoadError method of this handler will be called.
      Parameters:
      filename - the full path name of the file.
      Returns:
      true if the file is valid, false if not.

    • isFileValid

      default boolean isFileValid(InboundInputFile file)
      Check to see if a file is valid. If a file is not valid, it will be marked as error, and the OnLoadError method of this handler will be called. Implementer note -- there isn't much information in the file -- InboundInputFile fileName, fileSize, and content.
      Parameters:
      file - the inbound file info.
      Returns:
      true if the file is valid, false if not.

    • shouldIgnore

      boolean shouldIgnore(String line, int lineNumber)
      Check to see if a line from the file should be ignored, such as a header, footer, or comment line. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality an example is to skip comment lines or if CSV with header, to skip the header line.
      Parameters:
      line - the raw line as read from the file.
      lineNumber - the line number of the line (starts with one).
      Returns:
      true if this line should be ignored, false if not.

    • isSubRecord

      boolean isSubRecord(String line, int lineNumber)
      Check to see if a line from the file is a sub-record. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality
      Parameters:
      line - the raw line as read from the file.
      lineNumber - the line number of the line (starts with one).
      Returns:
      true if this line is a sub-record, false if not.

    • preProcess

      @Deprecated void preProcess(IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Deprecated.
      implement preProcess(InboundChunk, IntentionalLogger, Marker)
      Perform any necessary pre-processing, prior to processing Inbound Records. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. These legacy implementations were only called if the configured chunk size was 0. To do something on each chunk implement the preProcess(InboundChunk, IntentionalLogger, Marker),
      Parameters:
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • preProcess

      default void preProcess(InboundChunk chunk, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Perform any necessary pre-processing, prior to processing Inbound Records. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. Note that the default implementation duplicates the conditional check performed before the call to the legacy preProcess(IntentionalLogger, Marker). If this throws an exception the work item will be tried again later.
      Parameters:
      chunk - the chunk being processed
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • process

      void process(InboundRecord record, Bundle bundle, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker) throws InboundFileProcessingException
      Process an Inbound Record, and any associated Inbound SubRecords. Note that the bundle passed in is shared by all records in the chunk and will be committed after all records are processed. If no exception is thrown from this method the record is marked InboundRecordStatus.TC_PROCESSED otherwise InboundRecordStatus.TC_ERROR Implementation note - this is where the real work is done. The records were created while iterating over the inbound reader in the batch process. This is called in the work queue for individual records in the chunk.
      Parameters:
      record - the Inbound Record.
      bundle - the bundle to use for processing any additional entities (this is the same bundle as the Inbound Record).
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.
      Throws:
      InboundFileProcessingException

    • postProcess

      @Deprecated void postProcess(IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Deprecated.
      implement postProcess(InboundChunk, IntentionalLogger, Marker)
      Perform any necessary post-processing, after processing Inbound Records. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. These legacy implementations were only called if the configured chunk size was 0. To do something on each chunk implement the postProcess(InboundChunk, IntentionalLogger, Marker),
      Parameters:
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • postProcess

      default void postProcess(InboundChunk chunk, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Perform any necessary post-processing, after processing all in this chunk Inbound Records. Implementer note -- this is optional functionality. Note that the default implementation duplicates the conditional check performed before the call to the legacy postProcess(IntentionalLogger, Marker). If this throws an exception it will cause the commit to be bypassed and will setup the work item to be retried later.
      Parameters:
      chunk - the chunk being processed
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • onLoadError

      void onLoadError(InboundFile file, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered loading an Inbound File, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- the base implementation is logging, so call super in your method. This is called outside of the commit block so you will need to use Transaction.runWithNewBundle to create or update any records and commit.
      Parameters:
      file - the Inbound File that failed to load.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • onLoadSuccess

      default void onLoadSuccess(InboundFile inboundFileBean, int numberOfChunks, int numberOfRecords)
      Callback to perform additional actions on successful parsing and writing of records. Implementer note -- this will be called before the commit so that you can use the inboundFileBean.Bundle to create a outbound success record. This has the benefit that if the commit of the work fails, it will fail for any records created here.
      Parameters:
      inboundFileBean - the file parsed
      numberOfChunks - the number of chunks written
      numberOfRecords - the number of records written

    • onProcessError

      void onProcessError(InboundRecord record, String msg, IntentionalLogger logger, org.slf4j.Marker marker)
      Callback to perform additional error handling when an exception is encountered processing an Inbound Record, such as logging or emailing an administrator. Implementer note -- the base implementation is logging, so call super in your method
      Parameters:
      record - the Inbound Record that failed to process.
      msg - a message.
      logger - the logger for capturing these events in the cluster.
      marker - the marker assigned to this caller location.

    • calculatePurgeDate

      Date calculatePurgeDate()
      This will set the purge date. Implementer note -- this method is using the InboundFileConfig.getDaysTillPurge(), so normally you don't want to change this. However, you might want to set the purge date based on status as well.
      Returns:
      the date to set as purge date

    • onReadLine

      default String onReadLine(String line)
      This will permit the handler to preprocessing the read line and return null if the line is to be skipped entirely.
      Parameters:
      line - the read line
      Returns:
      the line to process

    • canView

      default boolean canView(@NotNull @NotNull InboundRecord record, InboundSubRecord subRecord)
      Whether the current user can view the current content Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records never contain PII then just return true.
      Parameters:
      record - record
      subRecord - if this is asking about a record this will be null
      Returns:
      whether the user can view the content

    • canEdit

      default boolean canEdit(@NotNull @NotNull InboundRecord record, InboundSubRecord subRecord)
      Whether the current user can edit the current content Implementer note -- The default is ServerUtil.isLowerPlanet() some other useful methods are User with custom permissions. Or if these records do not expose any risk then just return true.
      Parameters:
      record - record
      subRecord - if this is asking about a record the sub record will be null
      Returns:
      whether the user can edit the content
